line.text: Be wise as thou art cruel do not press
line.meter: s s* s s* s s* s s* s s*

line.text: My tongue-tied patience with too much disdain
line.meter: s s* s s* s s* s s* s s*

line.text: Lest sorrow lend me words and words express
line.meter: s s* s s* s s* s s* s s*

line.text: The manner of my pity-wanting pain
line.meter: s s* s s* s s* s s* s s*

line.text: If I might teach thee wit better it were
line.meter: s s* s s* s s* s s* s s*

line.text: Though not to love yet love to tell me so
line.meter: s s* s s* s s* s s* s s*

line.text: As testy sick men when their deaths be near
line.meter: s s* s s* s s* s s* s s*

line.text: No news but health from their physicians know
line.meter: s s* s s* s s* s s* s s*

line.text: For if I should despair I should grow mad
line.meter: s s* s s* s s* s s* s s*

line.text: And in my madness might speak ill of thee
line.meter: s s* s s* s s* s s* s s*

line.text: Now this ill-wresting world is grown so bad
line.meter: s s* s s* s s* s s* s s*

line.text: Mad slanderers by mad ears believed be
line.meter: s s* s s* s s* s s* s s*

line.text: That I may not be so nor thou belied
line.meter: s s* s s* s s* s s* s s*

line.text: Bear thine eyes straight though thy proud heart go wide
line.meter: s s* s s* s s* s s* s s*
